name: Blue Sun Empire.
description:
Agendas:

Eden Fragment: By far one of the most valuable. With this ID, sometimes, you're gonna need to bring back expensive ice, and re-install it elsewhere. If you can score this early, do so. It will give you a huge advantage when you don't have to pay the install costs.

Hades Fragment Kind of unrelated, but I just feel like it's a good counter to some Noise shenanigans. Noise mills agendas into your trash? Just put them at the bottom of your R&D.

Hostile Takeover: Easy money, and archer bait.

Priority Requisition: Hello yes, I'd like to rez a Curtain wall for free, and net 14 credits for it. Oh, Priority Req? Thanks.

Project Atlas: Just general scoring card. 3/2.

Assets:

Adonis Campaign: With this ID you can use Adonis as a mini-beanstalk. Install, rez at the end of the runner's turn, take it back to your hand for a net of 3. Also cool: You can rez, let it run out until the second to last turn of it, take it back for 4 and play it again.

Jackson Howard: Jackson, nuff said.

Upgrade:

Amazon Industrial Zone: Synergy with the ID. Install a card, rez for 3 less. Need to move a Curtain wall somewhere? Oversight it, take it back next turn, install it in the Amazon server, and now you have gained a net of 3 credits to rez 14 cost ice.

Operations:

Beanstalk Royalties: Solid econ.

Cyberdex Trial: May be an interesting choice, but with the prevalence of Noise Mill, Quetze3, and some lingering Anatomy of Anarchy, with some Andro Sucker mixed in, it's always nice to have a way to clear viruses. Also, with the new anarch resource, you can now econ up to prepare for that 2-6credits for purging viruses.

Hedge Fund: Standard Econ

Oversight AI: Best card for this ID, In my opinion. It works so well on getting you 'free' credits.

Reclamation Order: Only for Oversights.

Restructure: When you're taking back a hadrians at the start of the turn and get 10 credits, all the sudden you can restructure easy. Great card in this ID.

ICE:

Changeling: Just testing this really. I think it has potential.

Curtain Wall: Great Ice on the outside, oversight target # 1

Hadrian's Wall: Great standard Weyland big barrier. Oversight target 2

Ice Wall: Early game protection.

Lotus Field: Too much data/para recursion lately in my meta, need these to keep out the Yogs.

Quandary: Quick 1-of just for the early game, mid/late game it's a dead draw but it lets you use a jackson and have something to discard without real implications, I suppose.

Tollbooth: Just my favorite Code Gate. (Oversight target 3)

Archer: Super good ETR Sentry with program killing, gotta love it. Most likely don't want to oversight this. It's too strong of a tax/too good of Ice to risk trashing.

Caduceus: Good ETR, Runner shouldn't be ahead of you in money, but if they are, then don't boost.

Ichi 1.0: I love this card, I will usually put it on archives against Gabe or any criminals really, and just put it in the middle of a glacier on R&D vs any other runner. By sitting there face-down, I can wait until the perfect time to spring the trap so they can't click through both program trashings, give them a tag and brain damage, and then next turn, see if I can abuse that tag to trash some resource. It works doubly well with this ID because you can take it back to HQ after it goes off, and then place it elsewhere, but they won't know if it's Ichi or a changeling or a lotus or something.

I've had this deck prepped and ready for months, and will be testing it out tonight, hopefully it does well and I can make a changelog and update and such.

name: Fanatical assassin
description: probably too much focus on being able to kill ASH and Caprice without running them first.

name: Damage
Rielle Talk 2.1
description:
2.1 Notes:

Stealth Kit has been working wonders. Refractor really changed Kit's game and Astrolabe and Switchblade only make it better. This is a Pseudo Big Rig Efficiency deck that happens to be pretty easy to set up since Kit really only needs a single Refractor to be ready to roll.

The idea is to get in efficiently and cheap. Refractor is an insane decoder that's quick to install early and stays relevant. If you start with an opening hand of any stealth credit (Lockpick/Cloak/Ghost Runner) and Refractor or SMC, no early game ICE is going to stop you.

The most recent changes are switching BOX-E for Astrolabe and cutting Dagger for Switchblade (the +2 Influence from getting rid of BOX-E and using that towards Switchblade was perfect). Losing BOX-E makes this deck a lot more unsafe from Scorched and Jinteki, and losing the 1 console memory can be big, but Astrolabe makes the deck a lot faster. An opening hand with Astrolabe is hard to ignore. Even if the rest is garbage, mind who your opponent is and decide if they're likely to play a horizontal game.

Paintbrush is in the deck for when you're facing giant servers, but it's probably not needed most of the time. The only reason such a situational card is still in the deck is because it goes so well with Kit and it can be an absolute game-changer.

Leprechaun has been pulling its weight as a great memory alternative. Leprechaun is for housing Magnum Opus, Paintbrush, and any of your SMC's. It's basically paying 2 credits for 3 memory. After getting rid of BOX-E, I threw in a one-off of Cybersolutions Mem Chip for safety, and with Omnidrive, memory has rarely been a problem.

Early game economy is important! Later on, you'll be running efficiently with tons of recurring credits, but in the opening stages, getting your rig installed as you run with Refractor gets expensive. Honestly, an opening hand with Magnum Opus alone is worth it because you'll be set for the rest of the game.

Overall, this is a fun deck that is unstoppable if you get equipped with your essentials early on. It has a number of strong opening hands, and once it's set up, it can get anywhere without a hassle.

name: Domestic Counterstrike Ver: 0.2
description:
Runner needs to steal 9 points to win, you need 6 + Domestic Sleepers. I threw in Punitive Counterstrike for good measure and synergy. The rest of the deck kind of stated to build itself after these major strategic choices.. :)

I give up on you Amazon Industrial Zone. You just suck, no matter how much synergy you'd have with the deck. :( I'm not too pleased with the NEXT ICE either, but I'll test with them still..

Do I have too much code gates..? I found Eve Campaign to bee way too slow and Melange Mining Corp. to be absolutely fantastic, so I'm going to 3 melanges for ver: 0.2. Also adding one Cerebral Overwriter and one Fenris to buff the flatline threat.

name: Zaheer Meidan
description:
Step 1: Let go your earthly tethers (install Personal Workshop and host all the things).

Step 2: Enter the void, empty, and become wind (run on all the things).

Step 3: ???

Step 4: Get a sock stuffed in your mouth.

name: Blue Sun Empire. v.1.1
description:
Changelog:

Lots of things changed in just two games. Splitting the two games, I noticed a lot of problems. Namely, too much 3 point agendas, and too many small ice.

-2 Priority Requisition.

+3 Geothermal Fracking

-1 Amazon Industrial Zone just because it was very useful, but not as useful as I thought it'd be, can be skimped on here.

-2 Cyberdex Trial because nobody is running viruses that need to be cleansed currently.

-2 Adonis Campaign People would let me Adonis for 3 all day because it spent clicks that I could be using to get agendas out, changing it with +2 Aggressive Secretary is going to help a lot, because I want them to think it's an agenda and run it, so then I can trash programs, and use the windows there to score.

+2 Punitive Counterstrike I figure, with this deck, Agendas will be stolen, and when they are, it'll be for a LOT of money. So no way they can beat the trace, deal damage. Trash their recursion or whatever.

-2 Ice Wall. Too late in the draws to matter, too little to matter.

+1 Hive. Figure this will work somewhat better, since it's a good multiple ETR thing.

+1 Changeling This card is wicked, gives me more ETR sentries basically for the cost of an advance.

-1 Quandary Useless in this deck.

+1 Taurus Experimental add. Might just change to 2 hives later if this doesn't work out.

name: Silent Assassin Ver: 0.1
description:
First try at a Nasir deck. It looks like crap, honestly. :)

You need dagger AND stealth credit source before you can run safely so, maybe I'll need to up the Dagger count. Underworld Contact seems cute, but is it consistent enough..?

Untested as of 17/10/2014.

name: Punitive Suicide
description: Nisei Shell Game Flatline Deck. Port Anson/Bullfrog to force the runner even if he's too scared to go by himself and needs a helping hand. Install double advance a 3 pointer/overwriter. Double punitive etc.

name: Encrypted Code Gates for the win!
description:
I have been repetitively playing this for a few weeks making changes along the way, and it has had a decent level of success. I have found it strong in the current meta as it provides strong counterplays against:

a) Parasite owing to the presence of Lotus Field which I have found all round to be a fantastic central/scoring remote piece of ICE. Also having quite a lot of low cost:decent strength ICE makes parasite less problematic (also lag time/encrypted means i can often buff parasited ICE to keep it alive for one or two turns)

b) Fixed breakers/Atman owing to the presence of Encrypted + Lag time which means your ice strength will fluctuate throughout the game

Generally speaking Neo-Tokyo Grid has been a very strong card here, synergising well with the ID (you can place the Tennin tokens directly on Neo Tokyo to gain a cred and create an expensive to trash TOL bank).

The grail ice were a recent sub for 3 x ice wall and a surprise ICHI 2.0 (as a one of ICHI 2.0 can be a brutal game winner). I have only played a few times with the grails but with potentially both end the run and program destruction they function very well, especially when preceded by Inazuma.

RSVP is just a great card for making stealing punishingly expensive/impossible. It links up superbly with Caprice, Future perfect and NAPD, even if it doesn't stop the runner (the primary goal here) it can make the runs you can't stop horribly expensive.

Often TOL isn't even necessary for the 4/5 pointers and is often best deployed just as the mid game begins to rush out an encrypted portal to buff the majority of your ice and earn a few creds. Extending the mid-game by successively increasing the strength of your deployed ice through portals and lag time is usually the key to winning.

Anyway I look forward to adding Utopia shard here, I realise having no Jackson may strike as odd but I tend to ICE up all my centrals anyway, and Future perfect/NAPD represent 65% of my agenda points all of which can be semi-defended in archives through RSVP/Caprice if needed.

name: I will EXILE your deck!
description:
Just an idea playing around with infinite net damage and Chronos project. A few very short notes:

Mamba is just a better Tsurugi (even out of Nisei Division).

This deck will most likely suck against a expose meta, or siphon recursion, or Keyhole.

Otherwise expect to have a lot of fun with this deck. I'll try it out next Tuesday :)

If I see there is potential, I will most likely put in Snare! and 2 Scorches. Cerebral Cast too ;)

name: My first Weyland deck
description: Its the first time I build a deck, i would be glad if all of you could give me feedback, reviews are welcome :)

name: Waking up at Duggars
description:
The deck this is based off of one I found amazing, netrunnerdb.com/en/deck/edit/139170 by Diegofsv, even though Exile isn't as playable as I would like, this thing is fun. I'm about to build it at random, just to see how fun it is.

I dropped a Magnum Opus and added 2 ProCon's and 2 Aesop's, I kinda want to try R&D Interfaces and get Plascrete Carapace somehow.

name: NEH Punitive/Scorched
Dug-gami
description:
Alternate version: -1 Autoscripter, -1 Rachel Beckman; +2 Clone Chip.

Trying out Origami and Duggar's. Rachel Beckman actually hasn't been too difficult to install. Also trying to find a way to fit in Hades Shard. Maybe -1 Autoscripter -1 Mimic for +1 Hades Shard +1 Clone Chip? Also thinking about Savoir-faire as a way to install after using Duggar's.

name: Cerebral Blast
Origamizzard
description: Wow ! Much good hand size ! Fabulous scorched protection !

name: The Cerebral Palsy Division (Killer version)
description:
Ladies and gentlemen.

I present you one of the most respected and high security division to have ever been created, the Cerebral Palsy Division.

The CPD have been designed to make any netrunner that try to steal our private information to leave is criminal career after experimenting a few cerebral palsy in our servers.

Caprice Nisei and Tori Hanzo, two of the most notorious women of the Jinteki corporation, are working together to deal with every possible intruders.

They are in charge of the core security system and we have provided them with every tools they needed, like House of Knives and Mamba, to ensure they successfully protect the corporation's agenda and repulse any cyber criminal.

The Cerebral Palsy Division is the most fierce and respected division into the cyber world and will provide the galaxy with the perfect clone you have ever been dreaming of.

Our efforts will help to create a better world where cyber crime won't be a problem anymore for all of us. We welcome you aboard and to take place at our side to create a safer tomorrow.

If you are interested to know more about us, make sure to leave your comments on the investors board and our employee Exo will be pleased to help you and answer your questions.

Ok let's get into the real explanation now.

As I mention before, the deck is based around Caprice Nisei and Tori Hanzo. You'll be aiming at building only one remote with the two girls in it. With House of Knives and Mamba you'll accumulate net damage tokens to turn them into brain damage with ms. Hanzo.

To complement with this, Cerebral Cast and Schorched Earth will gives a lot of opening to kill the runner whether or not he has been brain damaged before.

One another good point that people might not have realize with Nisei Division is that the ID ability can also be use as a simple economic boost. With 3x Snare!, 3x Fetal AI and 3x The Future Perfect, you can let the runner go through when you feel it's safe by choosing 0 credits on the Psy game. You'll gain 1 credits each time you do that. It make every psy ICE to act like just like the Pop-up Window passive ability.

Edge of World is powerful here as people expect a lot more Cerebral Overwriter and you only have one in the deck so there is not many chance they are going to see it coming.

name: NBN Tag and Bag
description:
A first attempt at an NBN fast-advance deck with a tag and bag kicker. Standard Midseason/ Psychographics combo and mixed asset/operation economy. Win condition is either to fast advance via Astro, Misdeason, and Psycographics, or to stick a tag and double Scorched Earth.

If you have double SE, Breaking News, and Midseason in hand, you can play Breaking News and advance once. If they don't steal Breaking News, advance once, score it, and double SE. If they steal it, you can then play Midseason and double SE. Even if you don't get the kill, the mere threat of SE will make the runner play out Plascrete and keep a big hand, which drains their resources and turns on Sweeps Week.

Not sure at all about the ICE - I've chosen mostly cheap, taxing ice with some more expensive stuff. NAPD and Breaking News are both disappointing to steal, and none of your assets really need to be protected.

name: Nexmythification
Nasir ICE destruct with Grimoire
description:
Destroy ICE with parasite/suckers/wyrm. With Nasir's ability you immediately have credits to bring ICE down to zero strength with Wyrm, to insta-destroy upon rez.

Having enough money is the crux, since killing with Wyrm costs 2x strength of ICE - 1. Suckers help a lot as does the virus counter you get on Parasite from Grimoire (bring the cost down by 2 for each virus counter). Ghost runner and Net Celebrity are your other options for making up the difference. Archer is the worst (7 extra credits necessary after getting the Nasir money), while Janus pays for itself to die. You gain profit from killing Tsurugi.

Note that if you have Grimoire out you can insta-parasite any 0 or 1 strength ICE and kill after rez but before encounter which prevents Nasir from losing all his money (but also prevents him from gaining, so for something like Komainu you want to insta-parasite after encounter).

You can insta-parasite with Clone chips, SMC's, or Parasites on Personal Workshop.

Strategy of this particular flavor of Nasir the Destroyer is to get out Replicator early, use it to get all your Clone chips out, and use a copy of the Replicator to Trade-in for Grimoire. Destroy all the ICE you can, then Levy to renew Clone chips and Parasites. If you can install an SMC before you Levy, that can help keep up the momentum.

This deck can be fun, but very fiddly. Good luck!

name: Virus Factory
description: I'm not sure if this works, but it seems like a fun idea. Get six clicks, mass install virus programs, recur mass installs with same old things. Don't run at all unless they cerebral static, and then crypsis/darwin to get into servers. Mill as much as possible into archives, then hades shard to access.

-2 Modded +2 Scavenge is personal preference and unrelated to the trade-in plan.
